Good Afternoon,

Governor Newsom just declared that any county that is on the "watch list" will not be allowed to reopen schools until that county has come off the list for 14 consecutive days. Being that Tulare County is on the "watch list" regardless of last nights decision, RSD would not be able to open until Tulare County satisfies the COVID requirements. We are awaiting clarification on how this affects preschools. We hope to know by Monday.

Thank You,
Administration

Buenas tardes,

El gobernador Newsom acaba de declarar que no se permitirá que ningún condado que esté en la "lista de vigilancia" vuelva a abrir las escuelas hasta que ese condado haya salido de la lista durante 14 días consecutivos. Dado que el Condado de Tulare está en la "lista de vigilancia", independientemente de la decisión de la noche anterior, RSD no podrá abrir hasta que el Condado de Tulare cumpla con los requisitos de COVID. Estamos a la espera de aclaraciones sobre cómo esto afecta a los preescolares. Esperamos saber para el lunes.

Gracias,
Administración

College Student Summer Employment!

Richgrove School is once again looking for two college students that have come home for the summer and are looking for temporary employment! Students must be at least 18 years old, home for the summer and be available to work in the months of June and July. Work will consist primarily of outdoor campus grounds work. Individuals hired must be cleared through a fingerprint process at the cost of the employee after being hired. Position will be a minimum wage hourly pay for an 8 hour day, and will not include health and welfare benefits. The temporary employment will conclude on August 9, 2019.

If interested please come to the district office and fill out an employment application. Applications will only be taken until Monday June 3, 2019.

District Administration

Beginning the 2019-20 school year, Richgrove School District will be modifying its School Uniform Regulation.

When the students return in the Fall, they will need to be in school uniform Monday-Thursday only. All Fridays will be Free Dress.

Uniform colors remain the same. Students must be in cardinal, tan, white or black colors and all clothing must be plain with no design or lettering.

Should you have any questions please feel free to contact the school.

Thank You,

Administration
